channel.title: Metals Industry News Feed
channel.description: Automated news feed for aluminum, steel, copper, and nickel industries

item.title: AISI: Raw steel production eases to near multi-month low
item.description: U.S. raw steel production slightly declined to 1,734,000 short tons in the week ending December 6, marking the second-lowest weekly production since May. Despite the recent dip, year-to-date production is up 3.3% compared to last year, with a mill capability utilization rate of 75.7%. Regional production varied, with increases in the Northeast, Midwest, and West, and decreases in the Great Lakes and South regions.

item.title: Brazil steel quotas fill ahead of AD ruling
item.description: Brazilian steel importers are filling quotas for cold-rolled coil and coated steel ahead of an anti-dumping ruling. The report also highlights a decline in Mexican steel production and consumption year-to-date October, with production down 9% amid a demand glut. The most produced and consumed steel products include rebar, hot-rolled coil, and galvanized steel.

item.title: Worldsteel: China's steel overcapacity won't be easy to resolve
item.description: Worldsteel highlights that China's steel overcapacity is deeply linked to its economic structure, making quick reductions difficult. Steel demand in China is expected to decline by 2% in 2025 and 1% in 2026, driving record export volumes despite rising protectionism. The global steel market fragmentation also complicates efforts to reduce carbon emissions in the sector.

item.title: Copper reaches record high on supply concerns ahead of Fed decision
item.description: Copper prices hit a record high due to supply concerns, with 2025 production likely dipping below 1 billion metric tons after first ten months output of 817.87 million tons. The article highlights ongoing supply tightness amid global market dynamics. Related notes mention smelter challenges and production impacts.

item.title: LME aluminium cash offer rises to $2,867.5/t as opening stocks fall 0.47% to 525,800t
item.description: The London Metal Exchange (LME) aluminum cash offer increased to $2,867.5 per tonne amid a 0.47% decline in opening stocks to 525,800 tonnes, indicating tightening supply conditions in the aluminum market.

item.title: Secondary Aluminum Alloy Ingot Social Inventory Drops on December 9
item.description: Short-term aluminum price fluctuations have intensified, suppressing downstream procurement pace, with some die-casting enterprises facing challenges. The release of production from new aluminum capacity is expected to take some time, resulting in limited production growth in December.

item.title: BHP shares take centre stage as Citi tips record-breaking copper price to storm even higher
item.description: Copper prices reached a fresh all-time high above US$11,770 per tonne on the London Metal Exchange, gaining over 30% this year. Citi analysts project copper prices to average US$13,000 per tonne in Q2 2026, driven by a lower interest-rate environment, fiscal expansion in the US, European demand, and the global energy transition. This outlook is positive for BHP shares, a major copper producer.

item.title: Peru Extends Dispute License Period, LME Copper Fluctuated Overnight and Closed Higher
item.description: LME copper prices fluctuated overnight, closing slightly higher at $11,675/mt amid tight supply and weak downstream demand. Inventory changes showed a slight increase in LME copper cathode stocks and a decrease in SHFE warrant inventory. Imported copper prices saw minor changes, while domestic arrivals remained normal, indicating ongoing market volatility.

item.title: BHP shares take centre stage as Citi tips record-breaking copper price to storm even higher
item.description: Copper prices hit a fresh all-time high above $11,770 per ton on the LME, with Citigroup forecasting prices to average $13,000 per ton in Q2 2026 due to strong demand from energy transition technologies and AI data centers. BHP, now the world's largest copper miner, is expanding output with a $840 million investment in South Australian projects, benefiting from the bullish copper market outlook.

item.title: True North grows Mt Oxide with funding
item.description: True North Copper is raising $12.5 million to accelerate drilling and growth activities at its Mt Oxide Project in 2026, aiming to expand copper production capacity.

item.title: Nickel market set to remain in surplus through 2026: ING
item.description: Global nickel supply is expected to exceed demand again in 2026, maintaining a market surplus. This outlook suggests continued pressure on nickel prices despite potential supply cuts.

item.title: World's first AlN-based high-frequency transistor for post-5G wireless communication
item.description: NTT achieved the world's first millimeter-wave power amplification using aluminum nitride (AlN)-based transistors with over 75% aluminum composition. This breakthrough supports the evolution of wireless communication infrastructure beyond 5G, promising expanded coverage and higher speeds with potential applications in power conversion and wireless communications.

item.title: HRC Steel fell to 906.08 USD/T on December 9, 2025, down 0.21% from the previous day
item.description: HRC Steel price decreased slightly to 906.08 USD/T on December 9, 2025, down 0.21% from the previous day. Over the past month, the price rose 6.47%, and it is up 34.23% compared to the same time last year. The price is expected to reach 914.08 USD/T by the end of the quarter and 998.71 USD/T in 12 months.

item.title: SMU Price Ranges: Coated and plate inch higher, other products stable
item.description: Steel prices for hot-rolled and cold-rolled coil held steady at multi-month highs, with hot-rolled coil at $895/st and cold-rolled coil at $1,070/st. Coated steel prices increased slightly, with galvanized steel reaching a six-month high of $1,035/st. Plate prices resumed rising, up $5/st to a near four-month high of $1,025/st. Price momentum indicates further increases are expected.

item.title: Tata Steel Secures Indo-Sweden Funding Under the Industry Transition Partnership for Two Decarbonisation Projects
item.description: Tata Steel has received funding under the Indo-Sweden Industry Transition Partnership to collaborate on two projects aimed at accelerating decarbonisation in the steel and cement sectors. These projects focus on pioneering disruptive technologies and improving resource efficiency, including recovering metallics from steel slag and converting waste into sustainable cement materials.

item.title: Copper Rallies on Supply-Squeeze Fears
item.description: Copper futures in the US climbed to around $5.4 per pound, hitting their highest levels in more than four months amid ongoing supply disruptions and a large withdrawal of metal from LME warehouses, fueling speculation of a supply squeeze. However, prices slipped slightly as investors weighed demand uncertainties from China, which is balancing stimulus with financial risk management.

item.title: Comex Copper Settles 2.31% Lower at $5.2405 — Data Talk
item.description: Front Month Comex Copper for December delivery dropped 2.31% to $5.2405, marking the largest one-day dollar decline since late October 2025. The price has fallen for two consecutive sessions amid profit-taking and market caution, though it remains up 31.47% year-to-date and 24.08% month-to-date.

item.title: Copper Prices Hold Steady As Fed Decision Looms
item.description: Copper prices are steady near record highs as investors await the US Federal Reserve's policy decision amid ongoing supply constraints and mine disruptions. While copper trades near historical peaks, other metals show mixed results across major exchanges. The market remains cautious ahead of potential interest rate changes, with supply challenges supporting price stability.

item.title: Copper Prices Dip Amid Economic Uncertainty
item.description: Copper prices declined due to trader caution ahead of the Federal Reserve's Open Market Committee meeting and economic uncertainty. Despite China's signals of a proactive fiscal approach, investor skepticism remains, with weakening demand indicators and record-low processing fees for copper rods putting downward pressure on prices.

item.title: Copper pressured by profit-taking ahead of Fed decision - Markets
item.description: Copper prices slipped on profit-taking following a strong rally, amid concerns about slower US interest rate hikes. The market is cautious ahead of the Federal Reserve's decision, which is influencing metal prices including copper.

item.title: Copper Prices Dip Amid Economic Uncertainty
item.description: Copper prices fell on December 9 due to trader caution ahead of the Federal Reserve's Open Market Committee meeting and skepticism about China's economic stimulus effectiveness. Despite China's proactive fiscal approach, weakening demand signs emerged, including difficulties for fabricators to pass on high copper costs and record-low processing fees for copper rods.

item.title: Rio Tinto's Nuton technology produces first copper
item.description: Rio Tinto's Nuton technology has achieved a breakthrough by producing copper with significantly reduced environmental impact, using up to 80% less water and 60% lower carbon emissions than conventional methods. The modular system integrates biology, chemistry, engineering, and digital tools to unlock resources from challenging ores, aiming for the lowest carbon footprint copper production in the U.S.

item.title: Copper for Tomorrow: Sustainable copper production
item.description: The Copper for Tomorrow bid focuses on increasing sustainable copper production by addressing challenges in the value chain, especially processing lower grade ores with less energy and water. This initiative aims to double copper production sustainably to meet the growing demand driven by the clean energy transition and help companies achieve environmental, social, and governance (ESG) goals.

item.title: Nickel declines on negative price outlook for next year
item.description: Nickel prices fell as Goldman Sachs issued a downbeat forecast, expecting prices to drop 6% to $14,500 per metric ton by December 2026. The bank cited supply surplus and subdued demand factors, with spot nickel prices down 0.7% at $14,900 per ton as of the report.

item.title: Indonesia nickel matte production up 3.60% MoM in Nov
item.description: Indonesia's nickel matte production reached 36,900 tonnes in nickel content in November 2025, marking a 3.60% month-on-month increase and a 20.16% year-on-year rise. The cumulative production from January to November 2025 was 296,100 tonnes, down 7.79% compared to the same period last year. December production is projected to slightly increase to 37,100 tonnes, including both high-grade and low-grade nickel matte.

item.title: DUMONT NICKEL PROJECT EXPECTED TO DELIVER $1.1 BILLION ANNUALLY TO CANADA AND ADVANCE NATIONAL CRITICAL MINERALS GOALS
item.description: The Dumont Nickel Project in Québec is expected to generate $1.1 billion in annual real GDP for Canada, supporting thousands of skilled jobs and providing a secure nickel supply for North America and Europe. The project will increase Canadian nickel output by about 15%, bolstering battery and advanced materials supply chains, energy transition, and critical national-security industries such as defense and aerospace.

item.title: Vale Foresees Higher Iron Ore, Copper & Nickel Production Next Year
item.description: Vale projects a 10% increase in nickel production for 2026, targeting 170,000-200,000 tons, alongside a 3% rise in iron ore and copper output. The company aims to meet the higher end of its 2025 production guidance and plans capital investments of $5.4 to $5.7 billion in 2026. Vale is positioning itself to become the world's largest iron ore producer while expanding its nickel output.

item.title: Aviseo study reveals $1.1B GDP impact for Dumont Nickel
item.description: The Dumont Nickel Project in Quebec is expected to increase Canadian nickel output by approximately 15%, supporting battery supply chains and critical industries. The project will generate $1.9 billion in capital investment during construction phases from 2026 to 2035 and support nearly 11,000 jobs nationwide. It is designated a strategic project under the EU Critical Raw Materials Act, reinforcing supply-chain security for Canada and its allies.

item.title: Indonesia Signals Peak in Nickel Mining Investment as Focus Shifts to Batteries, EVs
item.description: Indonesia's nickel mining boom has likely peaked, with the government shifting focus toward downstream battery production and electric vehicles. The rapid capital investment in upstream nickel extraction is slowing, emphasizing the utilization of processing capabilities developed in recent years. This marks a strategic pivot from raw nickel mining to value-added battery and EV industries.

item.title: Italy's Cogne Acciai Speciali launches green hydrogen pilot plant
item.description: Cogne Acciai Speciali has started operations at a green hydrogen pilot plant in Aosta, Italy, marking a step towards sustainable steel production. This initiative aligns with the company’s commitment to reducing carbon emissions and advancing renewable energy use in its manufacturing processes.

item.title: Steel and Aluminum Tariffs Will Hike Costs - The Conference Board
item.description: The U.S. government plans to restore and elevate tariffs on steel and aluminum imports to 25%, with no exemptions for allies. This move is expected to increase domestic prices and escalate trade tensions, particularly with Canada, the largest exporter of aluminum to the U.S. The tariffs will impact industries relying on aluminum such as construction and automotive.

item.title: Column: China steel exports surge but aluminum shipments slide
item.description: China's steel production is informally capped below last year's 1.005 billion metric tons, likely dipping below 1 billion tons in 2025 for the first time since 2019. Weak domestic demand due to a sluggish property sector has led mills to increase exports, which are on track to reach a record high of approximately 117 million tons in 2025.

item.title: Nickel declines as dollar rises on Fed rate outlook
item.description: Nickel prices fell as the US dollar strengthened amid uncertainty over Federal Reserve policy and rate cuts. Goldman Sachs forecasts nickel prices to decline by 6% to $14,500 per metric ton by December 2026, reflecting cautious market sentiment.

item.title: Peregrine Hydrogen and Tasmania Energy Metals Sign LOI for Nickel Processing Plant in Bell Bay
item.description: Peregrine Hydrogen and Tasmania Energy Metals signed a Letter of Intent to develop a nickel processing plant in Bell Bay, Tasmania. This initiative aims to advance nickel processing capabilities, supporting sustainable supply chains and innovation in nickel technology.

item.title: World's first AlN‑based high‑frequency transistor for post‑5G applications
item.description: NTT reported the first demonstration of high‑frequency signal amplification using aluminum nitride (AlN)‑based transistors, showing millimeter‑wave power amplification with high Al composition (>75%). While focused on AlN semiconductor technology rather than metallic aluminum, the announcement highlights aluminum‑compound advances relevant to energy‑efficient, high‑frequency electronics and future wireless infrastructure.

item.title: Copper prices drop from record highs; Market awaits Fed policy
item.description: Report describes copper slipping from a record high amid market focus on upcoming US Fed policy and economic data, with benchmark three‑month LME copper quoted around $11,450/ton at one point while Shanghai contract moved lower; the report highlights investor attention on US payrolls and unemployment for Fed signals and records moves in other metals like silver and palladium.[2] It frames price dynamics as sensitive to rate expectations and Chinese demand indicators.[2]

item.title: Domestic Aluminum Billet Inventory in Two Regions Rises to 77,500 mt on Dec 10, 2025: SMM
item.description: Inventory of aluminum billet in two domestic regions increased to 77,500 metric tons as of December 10, 2025. Despite this rise, ADC12 aluminum alloy prices are expected to continue fluctuating weakly in the short term due to supply-demand dynamics and cost factors.

item.title: Benteler expands its casthouse at Raufoss plant in Norway for more sustainable production
item.description: Benteler Group completed modernization of its casthouse in Norway, increasing recycled aluminum use from 30% to 40%, aiming for 50% by 2030. This upgrade is part of the 'BAR Green' project to reduce CO₂ emissions and enhance sustainable aluminum production.

item.title: Steel unit price index falls 0.1 to 3.2 % in Nov - DoSM
item.description: The unit price index of steel in Malaysia recorded a decrease ranging from 0.1 to 3.2 percent in November 2025 compared to the previous month, with the highest decreases in Miri and Kota Kinabalu. Year-on-year, the steel price index declined between 2.7 to 7.9 percent across most areas. Despite this, the cement price index increased in the same period.

item.title: Decision to discontinue domestic price assessments for steel rebar and billet in India
item.description: Fastmarkets has discontinued its price assessments for Indian domestic steel rebar and billet produced via the induction furnace route, as most quality long steel in India is now produced via the blast furnace route. This change took effect from December 10, 2025, following a consultation period. The discontinued prices included weekly assessments for rebar and billet in India.

item.title: Leading Indian companies collaborate with Sweden's innovators to drive decarbonisation in steel, cement sectors
item.description: Several leading Indian companies, including Tata Steel and Jindal Steel, are partnering with Swedish technology leaders and Indian academic institutions to launch seven projects focused on reducing greenhouse gas emissions in steel and cement industries. This collaboration supports India's net-zero carbon emissions goal by 2070 through pre-pilot feasibility assessments of emerging technologies.

item.title: Why 2026 could be copper's breakout year
item.description: Production guidance for the QB2 copper project shows output of 170,000-190,000 tonnes in 2025, increasing to 220,000-255,000 tonnes by 2028. This gradual capacity growth is part of broader expectations that 2026 could mark a breakout year for copper due to supply constraints and rising demand.

item.title: Copper Chemicals Market — Global Growth, Segmentation, Forecast Through 2032
item.description: The global copper chemicals market is expanding steadily, supported by increasing demand in various industrial applications. Growth projections extend through 2032, reflecting ongoing investments and capacity expansions in copper-related chemical production.

item.title: Fluor Awarded Engineering, Procurement and Integrated Construction Management Services Contract for Teck Resources Highland Valley Copper Mine Life Extension Project
item.description: Fluor has been awarded a contract to provide engineering, procurement, and construction management services for the Highland Valley Copper Mine life extension project in British Columbia. This project reflects ongoing investment in extending the operational capacity of one of Canada's key copper mines.

item.title: Nickel fell to 14,753 USD/T on December 10, 2025, down 0.15% from the previous day
item.description: Nickel prices decreased slightly to $14,753 per ton, continuing a downward trend over the past month with a 1.81% fall and a 6.81% decline year-over-year. The price is expected to trade around $14,909 by the end of the quarter and $14,119 in 12 months.

item.title: [SMM Nickel Flash] December 10 news: Nickel prices extended their decline
item.description: Nickel prices continued to decline on December 10 amid expectations around the US Federal Reserve's upcoming policy meeting. The market faces contradictions with firm upstream supply but weak demand.

item.title: World's top cable maker sees US copper tariff as opportunity
item.description: Prysmian views the U.S. copper tariff as an opportunity to strengthen the American supply chain. The company, which acquired Texas-based Encore Wire, expects the tariff to benefit local players due to its domestic copper sourcing and vertical integration.

item.title: Aluminum Rebounds from 1-Month Low
item.description: Aluminum futures in the UK rose to $2,861.20 per tonne on December 10, 2025, rebounding from a near one-month low of $2,790 on November 18. The price increase was supported by macroeconomic tailwinds favoring manufacturing and fresh stimulus signals from Beijing to address its property crisis.

item.title: December Steel Price Outlook: Macro & Fundamental Drivers
item.description: Steel prices have been volatile recently with hot metal production slightly down but still high. Inventory is expected to decline in December, though destocking for sheets and plates will be slow. Macro factors, including domestic policy meetings, may support limited price rises, but persistent destocking and weak sales could constrain gains.

item.title: Steel Drops on Weak Demand
item.description: Steel rebar futures in China fell to a two-week low amid weakening demand, prompting mills to reduce production. Only 35% of Chinese steel mills were profitable at the end of November. Meanwhile, steel exports rose 2% month-on-month to 9.98 million tons in November, marking a record 107.72 million tons for the year to date.

item.title: Assessing Copper's Supply-Demand Dynamics as Prices Soar and ...
item.description: Global copper mine production grew from January to September 2025, with about 558 mines operating worldwide and a total capacity of 29.3 million tons. Despite new projects, supply-side bottlenecks and geopolitical factors constrain resource availability, leading to a projected 30% supply gap by 2035. China is advancing 'Smart Mine' technology to increase mining efficiency and reduce energy consumption, aiming for 800,000 tons of refined copper output in 2025.

item.title: The world needs a lot more copper. But will there be enough supply?
item.description: Several key copper mines experienced operational setbacks in 2025, including flooding and tunnel collapses, leading to lowered production guidance. The copper market is expected to enter a supply deficit as early as 2026 due to these disruptions and increasing demand driven by clean energy transitions and electric vehicles. Smelters face profit margin pressures, and any reduction in smelting could further tighten supply.

item.title: Myriad ups stake in Copper Mountain uranium project in Wyoming to 75%
item.description: Myriad Uranium increased its stake to 75% in the Copper Mountain uranium project in Wyoming, highlighting the project's potential to become one of America's largest uranium sources. The project has benefited from new permits and significant past investments, with ongoing drilling exceeding expectations. Wyoming is becoming a hub for uranium activity in the US.

item.title: SMM Nickel Midday Review: Nickel prices extended their decline
item.description: Nickel prices declined with the most-traded SHFE nickel contract closing down 0.7% at 116,920 yuan/mt. The market showed cautious sentiment ahead of the US Fed FOMC meeting, with prices expected to fluctuate between 114,000-118,000 yuan/mt in the short term.

item.title: FLASH: Indonesia releases benchmark prices for nickel ore in December period I
item.description: Indonesia's Nickel Miners Association set the benchmark price for nickel ore at $14,666.67/wmt for early December, down 2.21% from late November. Prices for different nickel grades also declined slightly, reflecting a softening market.

item.title: Nickel price hits 4-year low as gloom offsets potential Indonesia cuts
item.description: Nickel prices dropped to a four-year low due to a weak Federal Reserve outlook despite potential mining quota cuts in Indonesia. Futures on the London Metal Exchange fell as much as 2.3%, with nickel trending 8% lower this year amid concerns over supply and electric vehicle sales slowdown.

item.title: China nickel sulfate production down 9.14% MoM in Nov
item.description: China's nickel sulfate production fell to 206,500 tonnes in November, down 9.14% month-on-month, mainly due to production cuts and weak downstream demand in the ternary precursor industry. Despite this reduction, overall supply remained ample with sufficient inventories, leading to a continued downward trend in nickel sulfate prices.

item.title: Copper price rally resumes on supply warning
item.description: Copper price rally resumes amid supply warnings, with the Cobre Mendocino mine expected to produce 40,000 tonnes of copper concentrates annually. Broader market notes highlight record prices on US economic outlook. Supply constraints continue to drive volatility.

item.title: SMM: Domestic Secondary Aluminum Alloy Ingot Inventory Drops 602 mt WoW to 54,700 mt on Dec 11
item.description: Domestic inventory of secondary aluminum alloy ingots in China dropped by 602 metric tons week-over-week to 54,700 metric tons as of December 11, 2025. This decline indicates ongoing production growth and tightening supply in the secondary aluminum market.

item.title: Raw Steels MMI: Steel Prices Hold Steady Ahead of 2025
item.description: Steel prices remained consolidated with a slight 1.78% decline from November to December. Lead times lengthened slightly, and mills showed pricing flexibility. The steel price trend is sideways with a notable 37% drop in hot-rolled coil prices year-over-year, while some futures saw modest gains.

item.title: Steel Drops on Weak Demand
item.description: Steel rebar futures in China fell below CNY 3,050 per ton, hitting a near one-month low due to weakening demand and production scale-backs. Only 35% of Chinese steel mills were profitable at the end of November, down from 45% previously, indicating pressure on the market.

item.title: Trade minister raises concerns over Canada's steel industry safeguard plan
item.description: South Korea's Trade Minister expressed concerns to Canada about its plan to reduce steel tariff rate quotas (TRQs) from 100% to 75% of 2024 levels, which could impact Korean steel exports. The move aims to protect Canada's steel industry amid global oversupply but is seen as violating WTO rules and existing free trade agreements.

item.title: Ode to Noble Laborers
item.description: This report highlights innovations in steel technology at Baosteel, including the integration of artificial intelligence in hot-rolling steel processes and breakthroughs in laminar cooling technology that boosted steel product yields. The article emphasizes the role of skilled workers and AI in transforming traditional steel manufacturing towards smarter, more efficient production.

item.title: Copper Prices Rise Amid China Slowdown
item.description: Despite weak economic indicators from China, copper prices have increased as traders focus on tightening physical markets and long-term demand prospects driven by renewable energy, electric vehicles, and data centers. Supply challenges persist due to mine disruptions and difficulties in increasing output, particularly from major producers like Codelco.

item.title: Anglo American and Teck Resources Merge, US Fed Cuts Interest Rate by 25 Basis Points as Expected [SMM Copper Morning Meeting Minutes]
item.description: LME copper futures opened at $11,632/mt and fluctuated during the session, closing with a gain of 0.78%. Spot prices in Shanghai showed a mixed trend with discounts and premiums varying, while imported copper prices saw slight increases. The report highlights ongoing market volatility and supply-demand dynamics in the copper market.

item.title: Copper - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News - Trading Economics
item.description: Copper prices fell slightly to $5.30 per pound on December 11, 2025, retreating from four-month highs amid demand uncertainties from China. Over the past month, copper prices have risen over 4%, with a year-on-year increase of about 27%, reflecting strong market momentum despite recent volatility.

item.title: Assessing Copper's Supply-Demand Dynamics as Prices Soar and Inventories Drop
item.description: Copper prices have continuously hit historical highs with a year-on-year increase exceeding 30% on the LME. Global copper inventories have dropped below 1 million tons, intensifying concerns about a copper shortage driven by long-term supply-demand imbalances. Forecasts indicate increasing copper consumption and a growing supply gap by 2035.

item.title: Copper Prices Rise Amid China Slowdown
item.description: Copper prices have risen despite weak economic indicators from China, driven by tightening physical markets and strong long-term demand from renewable energy and electric vehicles. Supply challenges persist with mine disruptions, including difficulties faced by Codelco, the world's largest copper producer. The structural imbalance between demand and constrained supply supports copper prices amid short-term economic concerns.

item.title: Anglo American and Teck Resources Merge, US Fed Cuts Interest Rate by 25 Basis Points as Expected [SMM Copper Morning Meeting Minutes]
item.description: Anglo American and Teck Resources shareholders approved an all-share merger to form Anglo Teck, expected to become the world's fifth-largest copper producer with annual production of about 1.2 million metric tons. The merger aims to achieve $800 million in annual cost synergies within four years. Copper futures showed price fluctuations but closed with a slight gain on December 10.

item.title: On December 11, the SMM #1 refined nickel price was ...
item.description: The SMM #1 refined nickel price ranged from 116,400 to 121,900 yuan/mt with an average of 119,150 yuan/mt, down 1,200 yuan/mt from the previous trading day, indicating a continued decline in nickel prices.

item.title: The Morning Post of Nickel on December 11th
item.description: Nornickel, a major Russian nickel producer, announced that the global nickel surplus is expected to remain around 150,000 tons by 2025, signaling ongoing oversupply concerns in the market.

item.title: Indonesia's nickel matte output rises in November, MHP production edges lower
item.description: Indonesia saw an increase in nickel matte output in November while production of mixed hydroxide precipitate (MHP) slightly declined. This reflects ongoing shifts in Indonesia's nickel production dynamics amid regulatory and market changes.

item.title: Peregrine Hydrogen and Tasmania Energy Metals Sign LOI for Nickel Processing Plant in Bell Bay
item.description: Peregrine Hydrogen and Tasmania Energy Metals have signed a letter of intent to develop a nickel processing plant in Bell Bay, Tasmania. This project aims to enhance local nickel processing capacity and support the growing demand for nickel in energy transition technologies.

item.title: Nippon Steel lifts stainless steel prices for December on higher costs, recovering demand
item.description: Nippon Steel announced higher stainless-steel contract prices for December, citing rising alloy costs and signs of recovering local demand; the piece notes the move reflects input-cost pressures and tentative market improvements in the region.[1] The article indicates the pricing change is part of seasonal/contract adjustments and links it to broader stainless market dynamics and recent industry commentary.[1]

item.title: Steel Rebounds on Demand Hopes
item.description: Rebar futures climbed above CNY 3,080/ton on optimism that an improving macro backdrop and expectations of a US Fed rate cut could support demand, while market participants simultaneously awaited policy signals from China’s Central Economic Work Conference.[2] The report contrasts the rebound with recent weakness and notes ongoing demand uncertainty in China weighing on sentiment.[2]

item.title: Prices for rebar reached local highs at the end of the year
item.description: GMK Center reports that rebar prices climbed to local year-end highs, reflecting late-season demand and regional supply factors; the note places recent price moves in the context of seasonal demand and producer behavior.[5] The item is presented alongside other short market updates and regional production/news briefs in GMK's steel news feed.[5]

item.title: HRC futures were stable first and then declined today, with the most-traded contract closing at 3,238, down 1.19% for the day
item.description: SMM reported that hot-rolled coil (HRC) futures initially held steady but later fell, with the most-traded contract closing down about 1.19%, signaling short-term weakness in finished-steel futures amid fluctuating demand and inventory updates.[7] The coverage includes contract prices and commentary on market-moving factors for HRC trading that day.[7]

item.title: This week, social HRC inventory was 2.598 million mt; finished steel prices fluctuated downward
item.description: Metal News summarized weekly HRC inventory at about 2.598 million mt and noted finished-steel prices fluctuated downward amid increased blast furnace maintenance plans and reduced hot-metal production, highlighting supply-side factors influencing near-term price pressure.[8] The brief places the inventory and production developments alongside demand trends to explain recent price volatility.[8]

item.title: Thyssenkrupp pauses steel production at two sites citing Asian pressure
item.description: Europe's largest steelmaker Thyssenkrupp is pausing steel production at its Gelsenkirchen, Germany, and Isbergues, France, sites for about two weeks due to a surge in low-cost Asian imports, leading to underutilized capacity. The French site will also operate at 50% capacity for at least four months starting January. The company calls for swift EU trade protection measures to restore sustainable operations, amid ongoing challenges from high energy costs and competition.

item.title: Steel Imports Down 16.7% In September vs. August
item.description: US steel imports dropped 16.7% in September compared to August, with year-to-date finished import market share at 19%. The decline reflects ongoing tariff impacts and market dynamics affecting import volumes. This data highlights a continued reduction in reliance on foreign steel supplies.

item.title: Weyerhaeuser and Aymium Enter Agreement to Rapidly Scale Biocarbon Market
item.description: Weyerhaeuser and Aymium have partnered to expand biocarbon manufacturing, providing a sustainable alternative for steel production to replace traditional coal-based carbon. This initiative scales production of biocarbon derived from wood residuals, supporting decarbonization in the steel industry. The agreement accelerates the market for low-emission materials in heavy industry.

item.title: Copper price rally resumes on supply warning
item.description: Copper rebound pushed three‑month LME futures toward a near record as warnings of a sizable supply shortfall and mine disruptions supported prices, with LME three‑month futures settling at $11,556.50/ton after an intraday gain; the article cites structural supply concerns and demand drivers such as EVs, data centers and renewable energy boosting the bullish case.[4][6] It also notes a prior record near $11,771/ton and that short‑term moves were influenced by China demand data and the US interest‑rate decision.[4][6]

item.title: Copper rises with Fed rate cut, worries about outflows to US stocks
item.description: Copper prices rose after a US Federal Reserve rate cut, with buying supported by flows out of US copper stocks and continued concern about supply tightness; the article links the rate decision to the rally and notes movements across related metals.[7] It reports market reaction to monetary policy alongside physical market flows as drivers of price moves.[7]

item.title: Copper rises to record high on rate cut - Markets
item.description: Markets report that copper hit an all‑time high following a US Fed rate cut, with continuing flows into copper stocks cited as supporting the price surge and market commentary emphasizing tight fundamentals and demand from electrification and tech sectors.[8] The short item summarizes the market reaction to monetary policy and flow dynamics underlying the rally.[8]

item.title: [Nickel Midday Market Review] Nickel Prices Plunge Sharply
item.description: SMM #1 refined nickel prices averaged 118,850 yuan/mt on December 11, down 300 yuan/mt from the prior day amid Fed rate cut news overshadowed by weak fundamentals. SHFE nickel futures closed down 0.7% at 116,920 yuan/mt. Short-term prices expected in 114,000-118,000 yuan/mt range.

item.title: ZincFive Wins Multiple Categories in the 2025 Power Technology Excellence Awards
item.description: ZincFive has won awards in Innovation, Product Launch, Safety, and Environmental Excellence for its nickel-zinc battery technology, which offers high power density, inherent safety, and 25-50% lower lifetime greenhouse gas emissions than lead-acid or lithium-ion alternatives. The technology supports sustainability through recyclable materials and is deployed in nearly 2 gigawatts of systems for AI-driven data centers. This recognition underscores ZincFive's leadership in safe, sustainable power solutions for mission-critical infrastructure.

item.title: ZincFive Secures $30M in Oversubscribed Series F Financing to Power the Data Center Infrastructure Behind the AI Boom
item.description: ZincFive raised $30 million in oversubscribed Series F financing to expand its nickel-zinc battery technology, which provides superior power density, safety, and sustainability for data centers powering the AI boom. The funding supports scaling production of these environmentally friendly batteries as an alternative to traditional chemistries.

item.title: Australia Pledges Deal to Keep Giant Rio Tinto Aluminum Smelter Open
item.description: Australian federal and state governments have agreed to collaborate with Rio Tinto's Tomago Aluminium, the country's largest smelter producing nearly 40% of Australia's aluminum (up to 590,000 metric tons yearly), to secure affordable power post-2028 and prevent closure due to high energy costs exceeding 40% of operations. The deal includes at least A$1 billion in investments over the next decade. Tomago, operational since 1983, is Australia's biggest electricity user.

item.title: Aluminum melted with Annular Fresnel solar at over 700°C
item.description: Researchers demonstrated an annular Fresnel solar furnace capable of reaching temperatures above 700°C to melt and cast aluminum, showing a practical, low‑cost route for solar-driven aluminum recycling and production of branded ingots during field trials conducted in 2024–2025. The team argues the approach could enable near‑zero‑carbon aluminum recycling at scale in high‑DNI regions such as northern Chile, supporting circular-economy goals and interest from multinationals seeking ‘green aluminum’.

item.title: Tomago Aluminium welcomes continued collaboration on future operations
item.description: Tomago Aluminium and partners confirmed ongoing collaboration regarding the smelter's future operations, reflecting discussions about operational strategy and the site’s long‑term viability amid evolving energy and sustainability considerations. The release underscores stakeholder engagement around the aluminum operation’s future and potential transitions tied to decarbonization pathways.

item.title: Panasonic Group to showcase AI driven business solutions and circular‑design recycling advances
item.description: Panasonic described BIPV developments and next‑generation recycling infrastructure that enable precise disassembly and high‑purity separation of materials (including metals), aiming to produce high‑quality recycled materials and advance circularity by fiscal 2028. The announcement emphasizes design for maintainability and material recovery that can support sustainable metal (including aluminum) recycling streams.

item.title: Global Iron and Steel Prices and News 12.12.2025
item.description: Steel Radar's market page compiles the latest prices, indices and short market notes for global iron and steel exchanges, providing snapshot price data (including Shanghai rebar futures) and links to recent price movements and news updates relevant to traders and analysts.[3] The page is structured as a running market bulletin with dated price lines and short topical items for rebar, scrap and iron markets.[3]

item.title: Utility Global and Kyocera Join Forces to Scale H2Gen® Manufacturing Globally for Economic Industrial Decarbonization
item.description: Utility Global and Kyocera are partnering to scale production of H2Gen systems, combining Utility's electrochemical cell technology with Kyocera's manufacturing expertise for hydrogen production using industrial off-gases. This enables economic decarbonization in hard-to-abate sectors like steel by producing clean hydrogen without electricity, lowering costs and emissions. The technology targets blast furnace steel production, which accounts for over 70% of global steel output and 85% of industry emissions.

item.title: Whyalla Steelworks Hydrogen Integration Transforms Australian Green Steel Production
item.description: Whyalla Steelworks is integrating hydrogen-based direct reduction iron (DRI) technology to revolutionize green steel production in Australia. This innovation aims to reduce carbon emissions through sustainable steelmaking processes. The development marks a significant step toward low-emission steel manufacturing.

item.title: Capital demands soar for new copper supply
item.description: Development costs for copper projects have escalated, with delays in 13 of 22 analyzed projects; Capstone Copper's Santo Domingo saw a 55% capex increase to boost annual output to 68,500 metric tons. Barrick's Reko Diq in Pakistan targets 377,000 metric tons annually from 2028 with high capex. Capital intensity averages high across regions, underscoring supply challenges.

item.title: Nickel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
item.description: Nickel prices fell to 14,602.75 USD/T on December 12, 2025, down 0.05% from the previous day. Over the past month, prices have declined 2.39%, and are down significantly year-over-year. Forecasts indicate prices at 14,909.70 USD/MT by quarter-end.

item.title: [SMM Nickel Flash] Upstream-Downstream Contradictions Surface as NPI Market Stagnates
item.description: On December 12, upstream nickel offers increased but sales remained difficult, with most transactions at average levels. Supply side challenges highlight contradictions between upstream and downstream markets. NPI market shows stagnation.

item.title: Nickel Industries lifts 2025 nickel sales and receives green light for growth
item.description: Nickel Industries received approval to raise its 2025 nickel ore sales quota from 9 million to 10.5 million wet metric tonnes, restarting sales from Hengjaya Mine. A five-year environmental permit supports 2026 growth targeting 19 million wmt annually. This boosts near-term revenue to Indonesia Morowali Industrial Park.

item.title: Nickel Industries Boosts Nickel-Ore Sales Quota
item.description: Nickel Industries boosted its 2025 nickel ore sales quota from 9 to 10.5 million wet metric tonnes from Hengjaya Mine, resuming stockpiled ore sales to Indonesia Morowali Industrial Park. Five-year AMDAL environmental approval underpins 2026 quota expansion. Expected to enhance revenue streams.

item.title: Nickel Industries lifts 2025 nickel sales and receives green light for growth
item.description: Nickel Industries has increased its 2025 nickel ore sales quota to 10.5 million wet metric tonnes and secured a five-year environmental permit enabling innovative in-pit tailings storage and a limonite slurry pipeline for its ENC HPAL plant. This technology aims to position ENC as the lowest carbon and cost-intensive HPAL globally while improving traceability and reducing environmental impact. The company anticipates approval for a 2026 quota of 19 million wmt and focuses on commissioning the Excelsior Nickel Cobalt project for EV battery supply.
